availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Cornelius McLeod (Claysville, Kentucky, farmer and captain)

body.p: Claysville, Kentucky, farmer and captain. North Carolina native. Married to Martha J. Kenny McLeod. Father of John McLeod, Mary M. McLeod, Sarah F. McLeod, William A. McLeod, and Belle McLeod. Farmer in Harrison County in 1860. Captain in the 20th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) from January 1862 to January 1865.

ab.bibl:
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2 (Frankfort: John H. Harney, Public Printer, 1866), 60-61, 936.
Cornelius McLeod, 20th Kentucky Infantry, Compiled Service Record, (https://www.fold3.com/image/229605806) (accessed on May 16, 2017).
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, p. 697.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, Claysville, p. 3.
